Description: Fragment of a dark brown long wooden comb with a single set of long teeth of which 5 survive intact and two remain as stumps. Decoration on the handle comprises cup and double ring stamp marks on both faces.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), House 848 Room 3 entry way Level: Fill to Floor 1
Exhibition history: 2013 July - October, Cambridge, The Fitzwilliam Museum, Origins of the Afro Comb
